article_text: “Over half, 52 percent, are actually paying a portion of their refunds back,” Mark Ciaramitaro, Block’s vice president of health care and tax services, said at a presentation in Washington. These filers are seeing smaller refunds, on average $530 smaller. H&R Block said 38 percent of its customers who gained coverage under the act are seeing larger refunds, on average $365 larger.

article_summary:
H&R Block said 38 percent of its customers who gained coverage under the act are seeing larger refunds, on average $365 larger.
These filers are seeing smaller refunds, on average $530 smaller.
“Over half, 52 percent, are actually paying a portion of their refunds back,” Mark Ciaramitaro, Block’s vice president of health care and tax services, said at a presentation in Washington.
